title: Find tangent slope from parametric derivatives

content.question: The position of a particle moving in the xy-plane is given by the parametric functions x(t) and y(t) for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4105@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the slope of the line tangent to the path of the particle at the point at which t=2 ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
